intro: Thesium cuspidatum, commonly known as the spiked thesium, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Thesium cuspidatum is often found in wetland habitats and is considered an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
